text: - This is Phaneesh Gururaj, I work as
VP Engineering at redBus.
- I'm Puneeth Kadamba, I'm working as
an Engineering Manager at redBus.

- [Phaneesh] redBus is the
largest bus booking platform

in India in terms of our
pure bus booking volume.
It can also be across the board.

We are currently
headquartered in Bangalore.
We have other offices across the globe,

in Singapore, Malaysia,
Indonesia, Peru, and Columbia.
RedBus is a marketplace model.

We have customers who
want to hop onto a bus

and they need an easy way of
booking their bus journey.

We also have the operators,
which is a supply for us,

who have a large fleet
of buses on their side.

At redBus, we receive
thousands of reviews,
and we wanted to provide a better way to

showcase these reviews
to our end customers.
The main architectural goals here

was to provide these
user-generated content

in a much more simple
way in terms of tags,
so that he can make an informed decision.
Secondly, we wanted to solve at scale
because we have tons and tons of data.
Thirdly, we wanted to ensure that
for different kinds of reviews,
we wanted to have different variants,
or in terms of modeling, like different

machine learning models
need to be available
so that we can quickly iterate and
give it to our end users.

- Amazon SageMaker has
been a revolutionary step
in solving this problem where we are able
to save a lot of development time
in terms of the issues which we had
on our local machines.
And porting that same thing
to our mates on SageMaker has been helpful
to do a lot of continuous iterations

in training the model itself
and evaluating the model.

We have built this use
case on our own IT cloud

which comes within the
framework of Amazon SageMaker.

We have used the random forest
classification algorithm
to do our multi-level classification.

We have all started using
the bring your own model
technique of Amazon SageMaker.

- The benefit of using
the SageMaker has been

number one, conversion
rate has improved by 5%.

Our click-through rate
has improved close to 20%,

and finally the time to
go to market has actually
reduced from a couple of months
to almost a couple of weeks now.
One of the business objective was to

scale during a lot of our
peak periods flawlessly,
and AWS definitely has ensured that
we are able to handle that well at scale.

RedBus has been the earliest
adopters of AWS in India.
Just when the cloud was picking up,

we made a good choice of
getting onto the AWS platform.
The plugin architecture of AWS provides
a ready platform for the tech community
to provide seamless user experiences.

Almost all our workloads
pulled from development

and in that production
work on AWS systems.

We have been adapting
to the latest offerings
that are coming out there.
